snippet: Syrian insurgents released 13 nuns and three attendants who disappeared three months ago from their monastery in the ancient Christian town of Maaloula, Lebanese and Syrian officials said early Monday.
abstract: Syrian insurgents release 13 nuns and three attendants who were held for three months after being abducted from monastery in ancient Christian town of Maaloula; release ends drama in which rebels said they were protecting nuns from government shelling and Syrian officials said they were abducted in act of intimidation against Christians.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: Syrian insurgents released 13 nuns and three attendants who disappeared three months ago from their monastery in the ancient Christian town of Maaloula, Lebanese and Syrian officials said early Monday.

headline.main: Nuns Released by Syrians After Three-Month Ordeal
headline.print_headline: Nuns Released by Syrians After Three-Month Ordeal

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
